required_fields.description: Date when the person last entered the United States.

structured_data.full_markdown_summary:
# Immigrant Petition for Alien Workers (Form I-140)

## Overview
The **Form I-140** is an immigration petition used by employers to sponsor foreign workers for permanent residency in the United States. This form is filed with the **U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS)** and is essential for various employment-based immigration categories.

## Purpose
The form serves to classify an alien worker under specific employment categories, including:
- **203(b)(1)(A)**: Alien of extraordinary ability
- **203(b)(1)(B)**: Outstanding professor or researcher
- **203(b)(1)(C)**: Multinational executive or manager
- **203(b)(2)**: Member of professions with advanced degrees or exceptional ability
- **203(b)(3)**: Skilled workers, professionals, and other workers

## Eligibility
To file this petition, the petitioner must demonstrate that the alien worker meets the qualifications for the selected classification. This may include:
- Evidence of extraordinary ability or achievements
- Academic qualifications and professional experience
- Labor certification (if required)

## Required Information
The form requires detailed information about both the petitioner (employer) and the beneficiary (foreign worker), including:
- Names and addresses
- Employment details
- Immigration status and history

## Supporting Documents
When submitting Form I-140, the following supporting documents may be required:
- Labor Certification (if applicable)
- Evidence of qualifications (degrees, experience)
- Proof of ability to pay the offered wage

## Submission
The petition can be submitted either by mail or online through the USCIS website. It is crucial to ensure that all required fields are completed accurately to avoid delays in processing.

## Fees
The filing fee for Form I-140 is **$700**. Additional fees may apply depending on the specific circumstances of the petition.

## Processing Time
The expected processing time for Form I-140 is typically between **6 to 12 months**, depending on the service center and the complexity of the case.

## Conclusion
Form I-140 is a critical step for employers seeking to hire foreign workers permanently. Proper completion and submission of this form, along with the necessary supporting documents, are essential for a successful petition.
